resources.string: The board consists of 9 regular tic tac toe boards, called mini boards.
To win a mini board, you must be the first player to claim 3 boxes in a straight line.
Player X wins this mini board.
To win the game, one player needs to win 3 mini boards in a straight line.
In this example, Player O wins with 3 mini boards in a diagonal line from the top left to the bottom right.
In this complex example, Player X wins with 3 mini boards in a line at the bottom of the game board.
The <font color="#EE0000">red mini board</font> shows where the next move will be played.
The <font color="#6060FF">blue mini board</font> is enlarged at the bottom of the screen. The player may change the enlarged board.
If the mini board to be played in is enlarged, it will be <font color="#EE00EE">pink</font>.
The <font color="#29F950">green X</font> shows the last move. It is now Player O\'s turn.
For example, player O chose the top right box of the middle mini board. This means Player X must now choose any box in the top right mini board.
Player X chose the bottom center box of the top right box. Player O must now choose any box in the bottom center mini board.
Player O chose the top left box of the bottom center mini board. Player X must now choose any box in the top left mini board.
You send your opponent to the mini board corresponding to the box you played in.
If all of the boxes in the mini board you must play in are claimed, you can instead choose any unclaimed box on the whole board.
